definition: preventative measures/to guard against accident or disaster
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
to prevent troubles before the event (idiom)/to forestall/to nip sth in the bud
to prevent a disaster before the event (idiom); to nip sth in the bud

sentences.english: The key to avoiding this scam is awareness.
sentences.chinese: 爲防受騙，防患未然是關鍵。

sentences.english: Opt for frequent cleanings to nip tarnish in the bud.
sentences.chinese: 只有經常的清潔才能防患於未然。

sentences.english: A danger foreseen is half avoided.
sentences.chinese: 預見隱患猶如防患一半。

sentences.english: To sum up, prevention of the occurrence and development of diseases, prevention of the will.
sentences.chinese: 概而言之，就是預防疾病的發生和發展，防患於未然。

sentences.english: This movie describes concrete deterioration and the way to solve the problem.
sentences.chinese: 本影片主要描述混凝土劣化及其防患對策。

sentences.english: Prepare for the latent dangers before they materialize by seeking for preventive measures pro-actively.
sentences.chinese: 主動挖掘預防措施，努力做到防患於未然。

sentences.english: E. g. Regarding this shipment, we'd better stem the tide.
sentences.chinese: 關於這批運輸貨品，我們最好防患於未然。

sentences.english: The feature of TQM is "Management in advance, prevention before troubles occur".
sentences.chinese: TQM的特色反映在“事前管理，防患於未然”。

sentences.english: By knowing a person's rules, you can head off these challenges in advance.
sentences.chinese: 事先了解一個人的個人規則將可以防患未然。

definition: to prevent troubles before the event (idiom)/to forestall/to nip sth in the bud
lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty/to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
at the earliest possible time/as soon as possible
to bring honor to one's ancestors and benefit future generations (idiom)
to take radical measures/to get to the root (of a problem etc)
